title: Terror of the Zygons
dialogue_triumphs: The Doctor gives Broton advice on public relations: 'You can't rule the world in hiding. You've got to come out onto the balcony sometimes and wave a tentacle.'
goofs: The Doctor states that he has been dragged '270 million miles' by the Brigadier. (The distance from Jupiter's furthermost satellite to Earth is closer to 370 million miles).

continuity_notes.name: The Doctor
continuity_notes.description: Time Lord protagonist with the ability to mesmerize others

continuity_notes.name: Sarah Jane Smith
continuity_notes.current_status: Accompanying the Doctor, nearly suffocated in a decompression chamber

continuity_notes.name: Zygons
continuity_notes.description: Alien race seeking to conquer Earth after their home planet was destroyed
continuity_notes.current_status: Attempting to take over Earth as their new home

continuity_notes.name: Skarasen
continuity_notes.description: Cyborg creature, also known as the Loch Ness Monster, serving as the Zygons' life-source
continuity_notes.current_status: Providing lactic fluid for Zygons' survival

continuity_notes.name: UNIT
continuity_notes.description: United Nations Intelligence Taskforce, dealing with extraterrestrial threats

continuity_notes.name: Brigadier Lethbridge-Stewart
continuity_notes.current_status: Summoning the Doctor to help with the investigation

technobabble: The 'space-time telegraph' that summoned the Doctor at the end of the previous story is renamed the psionic beam.
The Zygon ship operates on a 'dynacron thrust'.
'You underestimated the power of organic crystalography.'

untold_adventures: The Doctor's encounter with a Tibetan monk where he learned the mesmerizing technique
additional_notes: The episode features double entendres involving the Doctor manipulating phallic controls in the Zygon ship and his comment about explosions.
bottom_line: There are amusing acknowledgements of some of Doctor Who's visual limitations in a story still remembered for the clumsy puppet Skarasen. The Doctor hears of the Zygon's plans to conquer the Earth and asks, 'Isn't it a bit large for just about six of you?'
